title: Black Britons discuss impact of Floyd
description: The BBC's Adina Campbell speaks to people in Coventry about the legacy of George Floyd's death.

title: 'Cantona-esque' - but should Edinson Cavani's sublime chip for Man Utd against Fulham have stood?
description: Match of the Day pundits Ashley Williams and Dion Dublin discuss Edinson Cavani's classy finish for Manchester United against Fulham, before questioning whether it should have been ruled out for offside.

title: UK government to pay older farmers to retire
description: Older farmers will be paid to retire under a UK government scheme to bring new blood into the trade.

title: UK must do better over electric cars - MPs
description: They're still too expensive and there are not enough charging points, a report warns.

title: Unpublished hospital patient safety reports exposed
description: BBC Panorama finds dozens of reports into concerns over hospital services have not been made public.

title: Israel-Gaza: Netanyahu says militants 'set back by years'
description: The Israeli PM vows to continue hitting Hamas in Gaza, despite international pleas for a ceasefire.

title: Champions League top-four race: Chelsea take control as Leicester lose grip
description: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel warns his side "the job is not done yet" - but is this deja vu for Leicester City?

title: Guardiola's Champions League final warning after Man City lose thriller at Brighton
description: Manager Pep Guardiola says Manchester City must improve for the Champions League final after Brighton come back to beat his 10-man side at Amex Stadium.

title: Charles Grodin: Beethoven and The Heartbreak Kid actor dies aged 86
description: Grodin, who was best known for roles in Midnight Run and Beethoven, died of cancer, his son says.

title: Chelsea beat Leicester to boost hopes of Champions League qualification
description: Chelsea beat Leicester City to boost their Champions League hopes - and leave the Foxes in danger of missing out.

title: Tyson Fury: 'Deontay Wilder wants $20m to let Anthony Joshua fight happen'
description: Tyson Fury claims Deontay Wilder wants $20m to step aside and let him fight Anthony Joshua.

title: Covid-19: Nothing conclusive on changing roadmap, Boris Johnson says
description: Boris Johnson says "we’ll know a lot more in a few days time", amid concern over the Indian variant.

title: Ceuta: Spain sends troops as 8,000 migrants enter enclave
description: PM Pedro Sánchez vows to restore order as migrants wade and swim into Ceuta from Morocco.

title: Ceuta: Spanish troops clear migrants from African enclave
description: Some 8,000 migrants have reached Ceuta on the Spanish-Morrocan border in two days, officials say.

title: Don't holiday in amber list countries - Boris Johnson
description: Boris Johnson says not to go but some travel firms are refusing refunds for those destinations.

title: Indian variant: Tower blocks quarantined in Germany
description: "Public order officers suddenly turned up and we were locked in," said one resident.

title: Covid: Nurse who cared for PM resigns from NHS
description: Jenny McGee says NHS workers are not getting the pay or respect they deserve from the government.

title: Vaccinating children before poor morally wrong, Oxford scientist says
description: Oxford vaccine leader Prof Andrew Pollard says adults in poorer countries should be protected first.

title: Met officer who shouted 'free Palestine' at demo under investigation
description: The uniformed police officer was filmed at a Palestine solidarity demonstration on Saturday.

title: Kane - should he stay or should he go? Options facing Tottenham striker
description: Should Harry Kane stay and cement his status as a Tottenham legend or leave to chase trophies elsewhere? BBC Sport weighs up the England captain's options.

title: Covid: Dominic Cummings accuses government of secrecy
description: The PM's ex-adviser posts tweets calling the handling of the pandemic "part disaster, part non-existent".

title: Yarn-bombers join M&S and Aldi Colin the Caterpillar cake row
description: Knitted versions of Colin and Cuthbert the caterpillar cakes appear on post-boxes.

title: Gas Boilers: What are heat pumps and how much do they cost?
description: No new gas boilers should be sold from 2025 according to the the International Energy Agency.

title: Why has May been so wet?
description: Many parts of the UK have already seen rainfall totals exceeding the monthly average - so why has it been such a soggy month?

title: Lost village emerges from Italian lake
description: Repair works at a reservoir in Italy have revealed the remains of a village submerged for decades.

title: In pictures: Fear and mourning as Israel-Gaza violence rages on
description: Striking images capture the human cost of the fighting between Israel and Palestinian militants.

title: Mother cat and kittens found in Amersham bird's nest in tree
description: The clan, including three kittens, is discovered after a week of searching by rescuers.

title: Newspaper headlines: Fears over variant spread as millions reunited
description: Many papers report fears that the Indian variant could delay the planned end of lockdown in June.
